title: just the tip
body:
whats one thing u do to outplay ur opponents
ex. riven q q (away from enemy) flash q back into them

replies.body: I have a pretty good example that I encountered recently. I was top lane Jarvan vs. Vladimir. Vlad is a natural pusher and I was giving him some decent poke with Q and an AA with passive up.  He might've just been an awful vlad player, but I found a really effective way to get him to pool so then I could follow up with an all-in.  All I had to do was drop a flag on him, but I wouldn't Q to it. He saw it as the threat and usually pooled thinking I was coming after him. So with his pool down I was able to really get up in his grill and finish him off multiple times.

> [{quoted}](name=Chon Wayne,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=Qztrya49,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-11T23:15:37.123+0000)
>
> I have a pretty good example that I encountered recently. I was top lane Jarvan vs. Vladimir. Vlad is a natural pusher and I was giving him some decent poke with Q and an AA with passive up.  He might've just been an awful vlad player, but I found a really effective way to get him to pool so then I could follow up with an all-in.  All I had to do was drop a flag on him, but I wouldn't Q to it. He saw it as the threat and usually pooled thinking I was coming after him. So with his pool down I was able to really get up in his grill and finish him off multiple times.

so ubaited his pool?

Q>AA>Q>AA>E>flash>Q>/dance

Sincerely,
    A Riven one trick pony
